title.narrative: OUTPUT 3 : CHILD FRIENDLY SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Output 3: By 2018, government and partners have increased capacity to implement inclusive and innovative CFS minimum standards to promote retention, age-appropriate learning outcomes and improved teachers' skills benefitting boys and girls including children with special needs, which contributes to Adolescents And Hiv/Aids, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Hiv Prevention, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Sanitation, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv, Wash In Schools And Ecd Centres. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Salaries and Related Costs

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 3: By 2018, government and partners have increased capacity to implement inclusive and innovative CFS minimum standards topromote retention, age-appropriate learning outcomes and improved teachers? skills benefitting boys and girls including childrenwith special needs

description.narrative: UNICEF provided technical support to accelerated learning program led to improvement in the retention and learning outcome of 4,701 children (46 percent girls). The rapid school readiness programme in 40 schools in Turkana improved the language and mathematic skills of 7,561 children (49 percent girls). | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/06/2018
